title: Lamine Diack becomes first president of the International Association of Athletics Federations | NEWS | World Athletics
snippet: Lamine Diack becomes first president of the International Association of Athletics Federations Sergey Bubka is elected to the IAAF Council IAAF agrees to refer all disputes to CAS for arbitration

title: Disgraced former world athletics chief Lamine Diack dies aged 88 | Lamine Diack | The Guardian
snippet: How Lamine Diack's 16-year reign in charge of IAAF led to a jail term ... The news of Diack’s demise was confirmed by his son, Papa Massata Diack, who said: “He died at home around 2am of a natural death.”

title: World Athletics | President
snippet: Diack was elected to the IAAF Council at the 30th IAAF Congress in 1976, held in the Canadian city of Montreal, and became Senior Vice-President of the organisation in 1991. Upon the death of the fourth IAAF President Primo Nebiolo on November ...

title: Lamine Diack - Wikipedia
snippet: He was president of the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) from 1999 to 2015. He was the subject of numerous investigations into corruption during his tenure ...

title: Lamine Diack: Disgraced athletics boss dies in Senegal - BBC Sport
snippet: Diack, who was convicted of corruption last year, was president of World Athletics (formerly the International Association of Athletics Federations, IAAF) from 1999 to 2015. In September 2020, he was found guilty of corruption and money-laundering, ...
